newsitem.title: USA: EQUIFAX INC SAYS CHAPMAN NAMED PRESIDENT.
newsitem.headline: EQUIFAX INC SAYS CHAPMAN NAMED PRESIDENT.

text.p: Equifax Inc, crediting Thomas Chapman with helping drive the global expansion and domestic growth of the company's financial services group to record highs, Wednesday named him president and chief operating officer.
"Tom Chapman has been instrumental both in the recent growth and

profitability of the company and in bringing new, innovative solutions to an information market that is increasingly global," said Daniel McGlaughlin, vice chairman and chief executive officer of Equifax.
Chapman takes over the president's post from McGlaughlin; chief operating officer is a new position.
Before assuming his new post, Chapman was executive vice president for the company.
Equifax provides financial information and processing solutions, serving industries that include banking, finance, retail, credit card, telecommunications, utilities and health care.
Equifax joined the S&P 500 index in June.
